headline: Oracle (ORCL) Valuation Check After Recent Pullback And Mixed Long Term Returns
summary: Oracle (ORCL) has attracted fresh attention after a recent pullback, with the share price down about 16% over the past month and roughly 36% over the past 3 months from its last close of $164.58. See our latest analysis for Oracle. That short term 1 day and 7 day share price weakness sits against a year to date share price return of a 15.91% decline. Meanwhile, the 3 year and 5 year total shareholder returns of 90.38% and 177.11% show how strong the longer term picture has been, suggesting...

headline: Oracle to Raise Up to $50 Billion in 2026 for Cloud Buildup
summary: Oracle is raising money to build additional capacity to meet the contracted demand from the company’s largest cloud customers, including Advanced Micro Devices Inc., Meta Platforms Inc., Nvidia Corp., OpenAI, TikTok Inc. and xAI Corp., the company said in a statement Sunday.  Developing AI data centers has pushed Oracle’s free cash flow negative, where it is expected to stay until 2030, according to data compiled by Bloomberg.

content.title: Oracle to Raise Up to $50 Billion in 2026 for Cloud Buildup
content.summary: Oracle is raising money to build additional capacity to meet the contracted demand from the company’s largest cloud customers, including Advanced Micro Devices Inc., Meta Platforms Inc., Nvidia Corp., OpenAI, TikTok Inc. and xAI Corp., the company said in a statement Sunday.  Developing AI data centers has pushed Oracle’s free cash flow negative, where it is expected to stay until 2030, according to data compiled by Bloomberg.

headline: Oracle to Raise Up to $50 Billion for Cloud Investment
summary: Oracle plans to raise $45 billion to $50 billion this year through a combination of debt and equity sales. The company is raising money to build additional capacity to meet the contracted demand from the its largest cloud customers, including Nvidia and OpenAI. Bloomberg's Neil Campling breaks down the situation.

Bloomberg's Neil Campling breaks down the situation.

headline: Oracle shares fall as investors assess up to $50 billion AI funding plan
summary: Oracle shares fell about 4% in premarket trading on Monday, after it outlined plans to raise $45 billion ​to $50 billion this year to expand its cloud infrastructure, fueling investor ‌concerns about its rising debt load.  The software company, chaired by billionaire Larry Ellison, said the ‌fundraising was aimed at expanding cloud capacity to meet contracted demand from major customers such as AMD, Meta, Nvidia, OpenAI, TikTok and xAI.  While companies continue to ramp up capacity despite limited visibility into potential returns, investors are concerned whether a ⁠surge in artificial intelligence-related ‌spending across the technology sector would generate sustained demand.

content.title: Oracle shares fall as investors assess up to $50 billion AI funding plan
content.summary: Oracle shares fell about 4% in premarket trading on Monday, after it outlined plans to raise $45 billion ​to $50 billion this year to expand its cloud infrastructure, fueling investor ‌concerns about its rising debt load.  The software company, chaired by billionaire Larry Ellison, said the ‌fundraising was aimed at expanding cloud capacity to meet contracted demand from major customers such as AMD, Meta, Nvidia, OpenAI, TikTok and xAI.  While companies continue to ramp up capacity despite limited visibility into potential returns, investors are concerned whether a ⁠surge in artificial intelligence-related ‌spending across the technology sector would generate sustained demand.

headline: Oracle stock rises after Fitch affirms BBB rating amid debt plans
summary: Investing.com -- Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) stock rose 3% Monday morning, reversing an earlier 5% slide after Fitch Ratings affirmed the company’s credit ratings despite plans for substantial debt issuance.

headline: Palantir Earnings Arrive Just as Stock Could Use Some Good News
summary: Shares of the software company have tumbled 29% from their November peak, reached right before Palantir last reported results, and are down 18% to start 2026, putting them among the 15 worst performers in the S&P 500 this year.  While the selloff has cut into Palantir’s valuation, shares still trade for roughly 142 times expected earnings, the third-highest multiple in the S&P 500.

content.title: Palantir Earnings Arrive Just as Stock Could Use Some Good News
content.summary: Shares of the software company have tumbled 29% from their November peak, reached right before Palantir last reported results, and are down 18% to start 2026, putting them among the 15 worst performers in the S&P 500 this year.  While the selloff has cut into Palantir’s valuation, shares still trade for roughly 142 times expected earnings, the third-highest multiple in the S&P 500.

headline: Oracle Stock Price Drops on $50 Billion Funding Plan
summary: Shares in Oracle (ORCL) retreated after the technology company said it plans to raise up to $50 billion this year to fund its cloud-infrastructure business.  Oracle stock was down more than 3% in recent premarket trading, at $159.32.  The stock spiked last year, hitting a peak above $328 in September on optimism about artificial intelligence, but have since more than halved on concerns about Oracle's hefty spending needs.

content.title: Oracle Stock Price Drops on $50 Billion Funding Plan
content.summary: Shares in Oracle (ORCL) retreated after the technology company said it plans to raise up to $50 billion this year to fund its cloud-infrastructure business.  Oracle stock was down more than 3% in recent premarket trading, at $159.32.  The stock spiked last year, hitting a peak above $328 in September on optimism about artificial intelligence, but have since more than halved on concerns about Oracle's hefty spending needs.

headline: The $3 Trillion AI Data Center Build-Out Becomes All-Consuming For Debt Markets
summary: Not even the world’s biggest technology companies—not Amazon.com, not Microsoft or Meta Platforms—are prepared to foot the bill with only their own cash.  The massive equity investments in private companies such as OpenAI and Anthropic don’t come close to this Industrial Revolution-size cost.  “The numbers are like nothing any of us who have been in this business for 25 years have seen,” says Matt McQueen, who oversees global credit, securitized products and municipal banking and markets at Bank of America Corp. “You have to turn over all avenues to make this work.”

content.title: The $3 Trillion AI Data Center Build-Out Becomes All-Consuming For Debt Markets
content.summary: Not even the world’s biggest technology companies—not Amazon.com, not Microsoft or Meta Platforms—are prepared to foot the bill with only their own cash.  The massive equity investments in private companies such as OpenAI and Anthropic don’t come close to this Industrial Revolution-size cost.  “The numbers are like nothing any of us who have been in this business for 25 years have seen,” says Matt McQueen, who oversees global credit, securitized products and municipal banking and markets at Bank of America Corp. “You have to turn over all avenues to make this work.”

headline: Netchex and PAR Deliver Connected POS, Payroll & HR Platform for Multi-Location and QSR Restaurants
summary: Netchex, a leading payroll and human capital management (HCM) provider for complex and hourly workforces, today announced an expanded integration with PAR Technology that connects quick serve restaurant point-of-sale (POS) and back-of-house (BOH) systems with Netchex payroll, HR, and workforce management tools—delivering a connected workforce platform for multi-location and quick-service restaurant (QSR) organizations.

content.title: Netchex and PAR Deliver Connected POS, Payroll & HR Platform for Multi-Location and QSR Restaurants
content.summary: Netchex, a leading payroll and human capital management (HCM) provider for complex and hourly workforces, today announced an expanded integration with PAR Technology that connects quick serve restaurant point-of-sale (POS) and back-of-house (BOH) systems with Netchex payroll, HR, and workforce management tools—delivering a connected workforce platform for multi-location and quick-service restaurant (QSR) organizations.

headline: Oracle rises as $50 billion raise eases data-center funding fears
summary: Oracle shares gained 2.5% on Monday after Wall Street analysts said the software company's $50 billion fundraising plan allays worries over its ability to finance a massive data-center expansion with ​OpenAI.  But investors have grown worried about how it would fund the ‌data-center expansion needed to serve OpenAI and other customers, including Elon Musk's xAI and Meta.

content.summary: Oracle shares gained 2.5% on Monday after Wall Street analysts said the software company's $50 billion fundraising plan allays worries over its ability to finance a massive data-center expansion with ​OpenAI.  But investors have grown worried about how it would fund the ‌data-center expansion needed to serve OpenAI and other customers, including Elon Musk's xAI and Meta.

headline: Oracle to raise $50B for AI, Devon–Coterra deal, crypto stocks fall
summary: Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre joins Morning Brief host Julie Hyman to take a look at some of Monday morning's trending tickers and stories. Devon Energy Corporation (DVN) will acquire Coterra (CTRA) in an all-stock deal. Oracle (ORCL) said it would raise $50 billion for its artificial intelligence (AI) build-out.   Crypto stocks, including Strategy (MSTR), Coinbase (COIN), and Robinhood (HOOD), are all trading lower. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: Oracle to raise $50B for AI, Devon–Coterra deal, crypto stocks fall
content.description:
Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre joins Morning Brief host Julie Hyman to take a look at some of Monday morning's trending tickers and stories.

Devon Energy Corporation (DVN) will acquire Coterra (CTRA) in an all-stock deal.

Oracle (ORCL) said it would raise $50 billion for its artificial intelligence (AI) build-out.  

Crypto stocks, including Strategy (MSTR), Coinbase (COIN), and Robinhood (HOOD), are all trading lower.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Oracle to Raise Up to $50 Billion in Debt and Equity This Year
summary: The company is raising money to build additional capacity to meet the contracted demand from the company’s largest cloud customers, including Advanced Micro Devices Inc., Meta Platforms Inc., Nvidia Corp., OpenAI, TikTok Inc. and xAI Corp., the company said in a statement Sunday.  On Monday, it kicked off a US dollar bond offering that is expected to be about $20 billion to $25 billion, according to people with knowledge of the matter, who asked not to be identified because they’re not authorized to speak publicly.

content.title: Oracle to Raise Up to $50 Billion in Debt and Equity This Year
content.summary: The company is raising money to build additional capacity to meet the contracted demand from the company’s largest cloud customers, including Advanced Micro Devices Inc., Meta Platforms Inc., Nvidia Corp., OpenAI, TikTok Inc. and xAI Corp., the company said in a statement Sunday.  On Monday, it kicked off a US dollar bond offering that is expected to be about $20 billion to $25 billion, according to people with knowledge of the matter, who asked not to be identified because they’re not authorized to speak publicly.

headline: Nvidia’s $100 Billion OpenAI Investment Plan Reportedly Hits Snag Amid Internal Concerns
summary: Nvidia Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) is facing reported internal pushback on its ambitious $100 billion investment plan in OpenAI, according to a Wall Street Journal report that sent ripples through retail investor communities over the weekend. The news marks a potential shift in the AI infrastructure buildout narrative that has powered Nvidia’s 53% stock gain over the ... summary: The company is raising money to build additional capacity to meet the contracted demand from the company’s largest cloud customers, including Advanced Micro Devices Inc., Meta Platforms Inc., Nvidia Corp., OpenAI, TikTok Inc. and xAI Corp., the company said in a statement Sunday.  On Monday, it kicked off a US dollar bond offering that is expected to be about $20 billion to $25 billion, according to people with knowledge of the matter, who asked not to be identified because they’re not authorized to speak publicly.

content.title: Oracle to raise up to $50 billion in debt and equity this ear
content.summary: The company is raising money to build additional capacity to meet the contracted demand from the company’s largest cloud customers, including Advanced Micro Devices Inc., Meta Platforms Inc., Nvidia Corp., OpenAI, TikTok Inc. and xAI Corp., the company said in a statement Sunday.  On Monday, it kicked off a US dollar bond offering that is expected to be about $20 billion to $25 billion, according to people with knowledge of the matter, who asked not to be identified because they’re not authorized to speak publicly.

headline: Oracle shares gain as $50 billion raise eases data-center funding fears
summary: Oracle shares gained 2% on Monday after Wall Street analysts said the software company's $50 billion fundraising plan allays worries over its ability to finance a massive data-center expansion with OpenAI.  But investors have grown worried about how it would fund the data-center expansion needed ‌to serve OpenAI and other customers, including Elon Musk's xAI and Meta.  Its shares fell more than 15% last year, as its results in December showed a cash burn of around $10 billion for the first half of the fiscal year.

content.title: Oracle shares gain as $50 billion raise eases data-center funding fears
content.summary: Oracle shares gained 2% on Monday after Wall Street analysts said the software company's $50 billion fundraising plan allays worries over its ability to finance a massive data-center expansion with OpenAI.  But investors have grown worried about how it would fund the data-center expansion needed ‌to serve OpenAI and other customers, including Elon Musk's xAI and Meta.  Its shares fell more than 15% last year, as its results in December showed a cash burn of around $10 billion for the first half of the fiscal year.
